conclusion: Understanding the relationship between induced EMF and geometry of conductor in magnetic field
Rod is perpendicular to the magnetic field and moves with a speed v
Length of the rod is L
Induced EMF is given by ε = B L v
Rod is bent into two equal-length segments, each of length L/2
Segments form an angle θ with each other, speed of the rod is v in direction of angle bisector
Effective length of rod is projection of total length on direction of velocity
Velocity vector makes angle θ/2 with each segment
Effective length of each segment in direction of velocity is L/2 cos(θ/2)
Total effective length is L cos(θ/2)
Induced EMF in bent configuration is ε' = B L cos(θ/2) v
Ratio ε'/ε = cos(θ/2)
Angle θ is such that rod is divided into two equal segments and angle between them is 90°
Ratio ε'/ε = 1/√2
Re-evaluation shows effective length is L/√2
Induced EMF is ε' = B L v/√2
Correct ratio ε'/ε = 1/√2
Final answer is 1/2
